,   "\"What is the primary difference between Linear Regression and Polynomial Regression?
options: Linear Regression predicts categorical values, while Polynomial Regression predicts continuous values.
Linear Regression assumes a linear relationship, while Polynomial Regression can model non-linear relationships.
Linear Regression is used for classification, while Polynomial Regression is used for regression.
Linear Regression requires feature scaling, while Polynomial Regression does not.
answer: Linear Regression assumes a linear relationship, while Polynomial Regression can model non-linear relationships.

question: ,   "\"Which of the following is NOT a method for evaluating the performance of a classification model?
,   "\"What is the role of the kernel in Support Vector Machines (SVM)?
options: To reduce the dimensionality of the data.
To map the data into a higher-dimensional space where it can be linearly separated.
To prevent overfitting by adding a penalty term.
To select the most important features.
answer: To map the data into a higher-dimensional space where it can be linearly separated.
